    Calculating contribution to annual rate

    Getting started witn mm23

    mm23.Rmd

    Get MM23 data

    Download the latest MM23 from ONS. acquire_mm23() will download the full latest mm23.csv file, and return its location. By default it puts it into a temporary file, but you can specify where you want to put it.

    library(mm23)

# Puts the data in a temporary file and returns its name
mm23 <- acquire_mm23()

# Or specify a location
mm23 <- acquire_mm23("~/data")
data <- read.csv("~/data/mm23.csv")

    Wrangling MM23 data series and metadata

    The get_mm23_* functions will return data in a tidy format, eg:

    date cdid value period
    1947-06-01 CDKO 28.9 M
    1947-07-01 CDKO 29.1 M
    1947-07-01 CDKP 1.2 M
    1947-07-01 CZEQ 0.7 M
    1947-07-01 CZFB 0.8 M
    1947-07-01 CZFG 0.0 M

    Its more efficient to use acquire_mm23 first so as to only download the data once. But if used without parameters the get_mm23_* functions will download the latest data.

    mm23 <- acquire_mm23()
m <- get_mm23_month(mm23)
q <- get_mm23_quarter(mm23)
y <- get_mm23_year(mm23)

data <- dplyr::bind_rows(m, q, y)

    Use get_mm23_metadata() to return details of what each series CDID represents. Here is a random sample of its output. You can join data and metadata by CDID, for example with:

    mm23 <- acquire_mm23()
metadata <- get_mm23_metadata(mm23)

m |>
filter(cdid == "L55O") |>
left_join(metadata)
    cdid title category level pre_unit unit release_date next_release important_notes
    L7IS CPI INDEX 12.3.1.1 Jewellery 2015=100 NA NA NA NA 24-05-2023 21 June 2023 NA
    J4Y5 12.3.1.1 Jewellery CPIH Weights 4 NA NA 24-05-2023 21 June 2023 NA
    L5JS CPIH INDEX: Vehicles, spare parts & accessories (G) 2015=100 NA NA NA Index, base year = 100 24-05-2023 21 June 2023 NA
    A9G5 CPI wts: Energy and unprocessed food SPECIAL AGGREGATES NA NA NA Parts per 1000 24-05-2023 21 June 2023 NA
    L7MC 03.1.2.2 Garments For Women CPI Annual rate (%) 4 NA NA 24-05-2023 21 June 2023 NA
